conclusion: Liquids A, B, C, and D will flow out and need to be traced to predict which container (E or F) they will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquids A, B, C, and D are positioned at the top of the image and will flow downward. Containers E and F are positioned at the bottom of the image.
Various colored vertical lines (baffles) are present in the image, guiding the flow of liquids.
Liquids A, B, C, and D will flow downward and interact with the baffles, changing direction according to their orientation.
Liquids A, B, C, and D will mix as they flow through the system, influenced by the layout of the baffles.
The mixed liquids will eventually reach the bottom where containers E and F are positioned.
Container F is directly beneath the main pathway of the mixed liquid flow.
The mixed liquid collects in container F after passing through all baffles.
The liquid will flow into container F.
